com.mousebird.maply

Class LabelInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.LabelInfo

  • public class LabelInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    We use this class to designate attribute shared by a group of labels. Rather than specifying them individually they all go here. You would use this class in the course of an addLabels() or addScreenLabels() call on the MaplyController.

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

      • setEnable

        public void setEnable(boolean enable)
        Controls whether or not the geometry will be visible. By default this is true.
        Parameters:
        newEnable - New value for the enable.

      • setDrawOffset

        public void setDrawOffset(float drawOffset)
        Set the drawOffset for a label. This is rarely used.

      • setDrawPriority

        public void setDrawPriority(int drawPriority)
        Set the drawPriority for a label. Draw priority controls the order in which features are drawn. For screen labels, drawPriority controls what order labels are drawn with respect to other screen objects, like markers, but not 3D objects like stickers or vectors.

      • setMinVis

        public void setMinVis(float minVis)
        Set the minimum cutoff for visibility of the labels. This is the closest height the labels will be visible from. Defaults to 0.0 (always visible).

      • setMaxVis

        public void setMaxVis(float maxVis)
        Set the maximum cutoff for visibility of the labels. This is the biggest height the labels will be visible from. Defaults to off.

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(float r,
                float g,
                float b,
                float a)
        Set the text color as float values from 0.0 to 1.0
        Parameters:
        r - red
        g - green
        b - blue
        a - alpha

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(float r,
                      float g,
                      float b,
                      float a)
        Set the background color of text. This is what appears in the rectangles behind the text. Color components range from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        r - red
        g - green
        b - blue
        a - alpha

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(android.graphics.Typeface typeface)
        Set the typeface used in the text.

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(float size)
        Set the font size for the text. For screen labels this controls the geometry size as well.

      • setLayoutImportance

        public void setLayoutImportance(float importance)
        The layout engine controls how text is displayed. It tries to avoid overlaps and takes priority into account. The layout importance controls which labels (or other features) are laid out first. Bigger is more important.

        Defaults to MAXFLOAT, which is off. That means the layout engine does not control the associated labels.

      • getTypeface

        public android.graphics.Typeface getTypeface()
        Return the typeface used for the labels.

      • getTextColor

        public int getTextColor()
        Return the text color in a form suitable for Android.

      • getBackColor

        public int getBackColor()
        Return the background text color in a form suitable for Android.

      • setFade

        public void setFade(float fade)
        The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for new geometry to fade in and fade out. By default, fade is off.
